verses.verse: Now it came to pass, as David<WH1732> sat<WH3427> in his house<WH1004>, that David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Nathan<WH5416> the prophet<WH5030>, Lo, I dwell<WH3427> in an house<WH1004> of cedars<WH730>, but the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of the LORD<WH3068> remaineth under curtains<WH3407>.

Now therefore thus shalt thou say<WH559> unto my servant<WH5650> David<WH1732>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, I took<WH3947> thee from the sheepcote<WH5116>, even from following<WH310> the sheep<WH6629>, that thou shouldest be ruler<WH5057> over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>:

And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked<WH1980>, and have cut off<WH3772> all thine enemies<WH341> from before<WH6440> thee, and have made<WH6213> thee a name<WH8034> like the name<WH8034> of the great men<WH1419> that are in the earth<WH776>.

And since the time<WH3117> that I commanded<WH6680> judges<WH8199> to be over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>. Moreover I will subdue<WH3665> all thine enemies<WH341>. Furthermore I tell<WH5046> thee that the LORD<WH3068> will build<WH1129> thee an house<WH1004>.

¶ And it shall come to pass, when thy days<WH3117> be expired<WH4390> that thou must go<WH3212> to be with thy fathers<WH1>, that I will raise up<WH6965> thy seed<WH2233> after<WH310> thee, which shall be of thy sons<WH1121>; and I will establish<WH3559> his kingdom<WH4438>.
He shall build<WH1129> me an house<WH1004>, and I will stablish<WH3559> his throne<WH3678> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.
I will be his father<WH1>, and he shall be my son<WH1121>: and I will not take<WH5493> my mercy<WH2617> away<WH5493> from him, as I took<WH5493> it from him that was before<WH6440> thee:
But I will settle<WH5975> him in mine house<WH1004> and in my kingdom<WH4438> for ever<WH5769>: and his throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> for<WH5704> evermore<WH5769>.
According to all these words<WH1697>, and according to all this vision<WH2377>, so did Nathan<WH5416> speak<WH1696> unto David<WH1732>.

¶ And David<WH1732> the king<WH4428> came<WH935> and sat<WH3427> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, Who am I, O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430>, and what is mine house<WH1004>, that thou hast brought<WH935> me hitherto<WH1988>?

And yet this was a small thing<WH6994> in thine eyes<WH5869>, O God<WH430>; for thou hast also spoken<WH1696> of thy servant's<WH5650> house<WH1004> for a great while to come<WH7350>, and hast regarded<WH7200> me according to the estate<WH8448> of a man<WH120> of high degree<WH4609>, O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430>.
What can<WH3254> David<WH1732> speak more<WH3254> to thee for the honour<WH3519> of thy servant<WH5650>? for thou knowest<WH3045> thy servant<WH5650>.
O LORD<WH3068>, for thy servant's<WH5650> sake, and according to thine own heart<WH3820>, hast thou done<WH6213> all this greatness<WH1420>, in making known<WH3045> all these great things<WH1420>.
O LORD<WH3068>, there is none like thee, neither is there any God<WH430> beside<WH2108> thee, according to all that we have heard<WH8085> with our ears<WH241>.

And what one<WH259> nation<WH1471> in the earth<WH776> is like thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, whom God<WH430> went<WH1980> to redeem<WH6299> to be his own people<WH5971>, to make<WH7760> thee a name<WH8034> of greatness<WH1420> and terribleness<WH3372>, by driving out<WH1644> nations<WH1471> from before<WH6440> thy people<WH5971>, whom thou hast redeemed<WH6299> out of Egypt<WH4714>?
For thy people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> didst thou make<WH5414> thine own people<WH5971> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>; and thou, LORD<WH3068>, becamest their God<WH430>.

Therefore now, LORD<WH3068>, let the thing<WH1697> that thou hast spoken<WH1696> concerning thy servant<WH5650> and concerning his house<WH1004> be established<WH539> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>, and do<WH6213> as thou hast said<WH1696>.

Let it even be established<WH539>, that thy name<WH8034> may be magnified<WH1431> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>, saying<WH559>, The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, even a God<WH430> to Israel<WH3478>: and let the house<WH1004> of David<WH1732> thy servant<WH5650> be established<WH3559> before<WH6440> thee.

For thou, O my God<WH430>, hast told<WH1540><WH241> thy servant<WH5650> that thou wilt build<WH1129> him an house<WH1004>: therefore thy servant<WH5650> hath found<WH4672> in his heart to pray<WH6419> before<WH6440> thee.
And now, LORD<WH3068>, thou art God<WH430>, and hast promised<WH1696> this goodness<WH2896> unto thy servant<WH5650>:
